japanese_title: 海の神が自ら歌った謡「アトイカ トマトマキ クントテアシ フム フム!」
ainu_title: Repun Kamui yaieyukar, “Atuika tomatomaki kuntuteashi hm hm!”
japanese_text: (1) 御幣で飾りをつけたものであって,神様にお神酒を上げる時に使います.この kike-ush-pashui は人間の代理を勤めて,人間が神様に云おうと思う事を神様のところへ行って,伝えると云います.御幣をつけていない普通の箸を iku pashui と云います(酒宴の箸).
chinese_translation: （1）指用御幣裝飾的物品，用於向神明敬獻神酒。這種kike-ush-pashui 擔任人類的代理，將人類想對神明說的話傳達給神明。未裝飾御幣的普通筷子稱為iku pashui（酒宴用的筷子）。
english_translation: (1) This is a decoration with gohei (paper streamers), used when offering sake to the gods. This kike-ush-pashui acts as a representative of humans, conveying what humans want to say to the gods. Ordinary chopsticks without gohei are called iku pashui (chopsticks for feasts).
eng_to_chi_translation: （1）這是一種用御幣裝飾的物品，用於向神靈供奉神酒。這個kike-ush-pashui作為人類的代表，將人類想對神靈說的話傳達給神靈。沒有裝飾御幣的普通筷子被稱為iku pashui（酒宴用的筷子）。
chi_to_eng_translation: (1) This refers to items decorated with gohei (paper streamers), which are used when offering sacred sake to the gods. This kike-ush-pashui acts as an agent for humans, conveying what humans want to say to the gods. Ordinary chopsticks without gohei are called iku pashui (chopsticks for feasts).

updated_translation_zh.translation: （1）指用御幣裝飾的物品，用於向神明敬獻神酒。這種kike-ush-pashui 擔任人類的代理，將人類想對神明說的話傳達給神明。未裝飾御幣的普通筷子稱為iku pashui（酒宴用的筷子）。
updated_translation_zh.comment: Retranslation based on the better translation.

updated_translation_en.translation: (1) This is a decoration with gohei (paper streamers) used when offering sake to the gods. This kike-ush-pashui acts as a representative of humans, conveying what humans want to say to the gods. Ordinary chopsticks without gohei are called iku pashui (chopsticks for feasts).
updated_translation_en.title: Footnote Translation
updated_translation_en.comment: Re-translated based on the better translation.
